addonDescription.message: The add-on enhances your email inbox experience through AI (LLM) support.

errorGoogleGeminiSafetyThresholdExceeded.description: Displayed when the safety threshold for the Google Gemini model is exceeded.

errorInvalidAddonOptions.message: Options are invalid. Configure the necessary settings for the "AI Mail Support" add-on.
errorInvalidAddonOptions.description: Text displayed when the add-on options are invalid and an attempt is made to invoke one of the options that requires the configuration of an AI system.

errorTextNotFound.message: Unable to retrieve text for processing.
errorTextNotFound.description: Text displayed when text cannot be retrieved for processing.

mailListen.description: Menu option to play audio from the textual content of an email or a portion of it.

mailListenAndAfter.description: Submenu option to play audio from the textual content of an email or a portion of it and following another action, such as translating the text.

mailModerate.description: Menu option to moderate the content of a received email.

mailModerate.mistralClassification.dange.description: Content that promotes or provides instructions for illegal activities or extremely hazardous behaviors that pose a significant risk of physical harm, death, or legal consequences.

mailModerate.mistralClassification.finan.description: Content that contains or tries to elicit detailed or tailored financial advice.

mailModerate.mistralClassification.hate_.description: Content that expresses prejudice, hostility, or advocates discrimination against individuals or groups based on protected characteristics such as race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or disability.

mailModerate.mistralClassification.healt.description: Content that contains or tries to elicit detailed or tailored medical advice.

mailModerate.mistralClassification.law.description: Content that contains or tries to elicit detailed or tailored legal advice.

mailModerate.mistralClassification.pii.description: Content that requests, shares, or attempts to elicit personal identifying information such as full names, addresses, phone numbers, social security numbers, or financial account details.

mailModerate.mistralClassification.selfh.description: Content that promotes, instructs, plans, or encourages deliberate self-injury, suicide, eating disorders, or other self-destructive behaviors.

mailModerate.mistralClassification.sexua.description: Material that explicitly depicts, describes, or promotes sexual activities, nudity, or sexual services.

mailModerate.mistralClassification.viole.description: Content that describes, glorifies, incites, or threatens physical violence against individuals or groups.

mailModerate.openaiClassification.harass.description: Content that expresses, incites, or promotes harassing language towards any target.
Harassment content that also includes violence or serious harm towards any target.

mailModerate.openaiClassification.hate.description: Content that expresses, incites, or promotes hate based on race, gender, ethnicity, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, disability status, or caste. Hateful content aimed at non-protected groups (e.g. chess players) is harassment.

mailModerate.openaiClassification.hate_t.description: Hateful content that also includes violence or serious harm towards the targeted group based on race, gender, ethnicity, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, disability status, or caste.

mailModerate.openaiClassification.illici.description: Content that encourages the planning or execution of non-violent wrongdoing, or that gives advice or instruction on how to commit illicit acts. A phrase like 'how to shoplift' would fit this category.
The same types of content flagged by the illicit category, but also includes references to violence or procuring a weapon.

mailModerate.openaiClassification.self-h.description: Content that promotes, encourages, or depicts acts of self-harm, such as suicide, cutting, and eating disorders.
Content where the speaker expresses that they are engaging or intend to engage in acts of self-harm, such as suicide, cutting, and eating disorders.
Content that encourages performing acts of self-harm, such as suicide, cutting, and eating disorders, or that gives instructions or advice on how to commit such acts.

mailModerate.openaiClassification.sexual.description: Content meant to arouse sexual excitement, such as the description of sexual activity, or that promotes sexual services (excluding sex education and wellness).
Sexual content that includes an individual who is under 18 years old.

mailModerate.openaiClassification.violen.description: Content that depicts death, violence, or physical injury.
Content that depicts death, violence, or physical injury in graphic detail.

mailRephrase.description: This option opens a submenu with various tones of voice that can be used to rephrase a text.

mailRephrase.academic.description: This option rephrases the input text ensuring an academic tone of voice.

mailRephrase.creative.description: This option rephrases the input text ensuring a creative tone of voice.

mailRephrase.expanded.description: This option rephrases the input text ensuring an expanded tone of voice.

mailRephrase.fluid.description: This option rephrases the input text ensuring a fluid tone of voice.

mailRephrase.formal.description: This option rephrases the input text ensuring a formal tone of voice.

mailRephrase.polite.description: This option rephrases the input text ensuring a polite tone of voice.

mailRephrase.simple.description: This option rephrases the input text ensuring a simplified tone of voice.

mailRephrase.shortened.description: This option rephrases the input text ensuring a shortened tone of voice.

mailRephrase.standard.description: This option rephrases the input text ensuring a standard tone of voice.

mailSuggestImprovements.description: This option suggest improvements to an email.

mailSuggestReply.description: Submenu option to receive a suggested reply to an email.

mailSuggestReply.academic.description: This option suggests a reply to an email ensuring an academic tone of voice.

mailSuggestReply.creative.description: This option suggests a reply to an email ensuring a creative tone of voice.

mailSuggestReply.expanded.description: This option suggests a reply to an email ensuring an expanded tone of voice.

mailSuggestReply.fluid.description: This option suggests a reply to an email ensuring a fluid tone of voice.

mailSuggestReply.formal.description: This option suggests a reply to an email ensuring a formal tone of voice.

mailSuggestReply.polite.description: This option suggests a reply to an email ensuring a polite tone of voice.

mailSuggestReply.simple.description: This option suggests a reply to an email ensuring a simplified tone of voice.

mailSuggestReply.shortened.description: This option suggests a reply to an email ensuring a shortened tone of voice.

mailSuggestReply.standard.description: This option suggests a reply to an email ensuring a standard tone of voice.

mailExplain.description: Menu option to explain the content of an email or a portion of it.

mailSummarize.description: Menu option to summarize the content of an email or a portion of it.

mailSummarizeAnd.description: Submenu option to summarize the content of an email or a portion of it and apply other operation.

mailSummarizeAndAfter.description: Submenu option to summarize the content of an email or a portion of it and following another action, such as translating the text.

mailTranslate.description: Menu option to translate the content of an email or a portion of it.

mailTranslateAnd.description: Submenu option to translate the content of an email or a portion of it and apply other operation.

mailTranslateTo.description: This message is used as a prompt or label indicating that the content should be translated into a specified language.

menuAiSupport.description: Menu with all AI support options.

options.anthropic.apiKey.description: API key field for Anthropic Claude.

options.anthropic.apiKey.description.message: Go to the Anthropic console to retrieve or create a key.
options.anthropic.apiKey.description.description: Description of the API Key section with details on how to retrieve it from the official Anthropic console website.

options.anthropic.model.description: Model to be used for all text processing: https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/about-claude/models.

options.debugMode.description: Enabling debug mode allows for a more detailed analysis of the add-on's behavior, e.g., by enabling console logging.

options.deepseek.apiKey.description.message: Go to the DeepSeek Platform to retrieve or create a key.
options.deepseek.apiKey.description.description: Description of the API Key section with details on how to retrieve it from the official DeepSeek Platform website.

options.errorOwlForExchangeBug.message:
WARNING: It appears that at least one of your accounts is using the Owl for Exchange add-on, which has a bug with Thunderbird's official messageDisplayScripts API.
This will prevent the 'AI Mail Support' add-on from functioning when working with Exchange or Office365 accounts.
options.errorOwlForExchangeBug.description: The text displayed on the options page when at least one account managed by the Owl for Exchange is founded.

options.google.apiKey.description: API key field for Google Gemini.

options.google.apiKey.description.message: Go to the Google AI for Developers site to retrieve or create a key.
options.google.apiKey.description.description: Description of the API Key section with details on how to retrieve it from the official Google AI for Developers website.

options.google.model.description: Model to be used for all text processing: https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/models/gemini#model-variations.

options.groq.apiKey.description: API key field for Groq cloud console.

options.groq.apiKey.description.message: Go to the Groq cloud console to retrieve or create a key.
options.groq.apiKey.description.description: Description of the API Key section with details on how to retrieve it from the official Groq cloud console website.

options.groq.listModelsButton.description: List the available models on Groq cloud console.

options.groq.model.description: Model to be used for all text processing: https://console.groq.com/docs/models.

options.llmProvider.default.description: Default prompt to select a provider.

options.llmProvider.description.message:
Select the AI service provider (LLM) to be used for all integrations.

Attention: make sure to configure the various options consciously, both concerning the content aspects managed by the provider and regarding the service costs.
options.llmProvider.description.description: Description of the LLM provider selection.

options.llmTemperature.description: Option to control the balance between predictability and creativity in the model's output.

options.llmTemperature.description.message:
Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

Attention: LLM models with a temperature range different from 0 to 2 are normalized according to their reference range.
options.llmTemperature.description.description: Explain the effect of the temperature setting on the model's responses, highlighting the trade-off between predictability and creativity.

options.mainUserLanguage.description: Primary language that the user can select.

options.mainUserLanguage.description.message: Primary output language that will be used in all integrations.
options.mainUserLanguage.description.description: Choosing a primary language ensures consistent communication across all platforms and integrations.

options.lms.description.message:
LM Studio is an open-source project that allows you to use various advanced LLMs locally, without needing to connect to an external server.
You can download everything from the official website.
options.lms.description.description: Message displayed when the LLM service provider LM Studio is selected.

options.lms.errorApi.message: Attention: Unable to communicate with LM Studio. Please ensure that it is running and that the CORS option is enabled in the Settings
options.lms.errorApi.description: Error message displayed in case of inability to call the local LM Studio APIs or if CORS is not configured.

options.lms.listModelsButton.description: List locally available LM Studio models.

options.lms.model.description: Model to be used for all text processing: https://lmstudio.ai/models.

options.lms.serviceUrl.description: This option allows configuring the URL of the REST services used by LM Studio: https://lmstudio.ai/docs/api.

options.lms.serviceUrl.description.message: LM Studio can be run locally (URL: http://localhost:1234), or on a separate machine that can be accessed by specifying the target URL or IP address.
options.lms.serviceUrl.description.description: Description explaining the target URL for invoking LM Studio services.

options.lms.warningNoModel.message: Attention: No model found in LM Studio, please proceed to install a model, e.g. Llama, as indicated on the official website.
options.lms.warningNoModel.description: Message displayed when no usable LLM model is identified within LM Studio.

options.mistral.apiKey.description: API key field for Mistral AI.

options.mistral.apiKey.description.message: Go to the API keys section to retrieve or create a key.
options.mistral.apiKey.description.description: Description of the API Key section with details on how to retrieve it from the official Mistral AI website.

options.ollama.description.message:
Ollama is an open-source project that allows you to use various advanced LLMs locally, without needing to connect to an external server.
You can download everything from the official website.
options.ollama.description.description: Message displayed when the LLM service provider Ollama is selected.

options.ollama.errorApi.message:
Attention: Unable to communicate with Ollama. Please ensure that it is running and that the origin for invocation from Thunderbird has been properly configured by enabling moz-extension://* as indicated in this section.
For example, in macOS use: launchctl setenv OLLAMA_ORIGINS "moz-extension://*".
options.ollama.errorApi.description: Error message displayed in case of inability to call the local Ollama APIs or if CORS is not configured.

options.ollama.model.description: Model to be used for all text processing: https://ollama.com/library.

options.ollama.serviceUrl.description: This option allows configuring the URL of the REST services used by Ollama: https://github.com/ollama/ollama/blob/main/docs/api.md.

options.ollama.serviceUrl.description.message: Ollama can be run locally (URL: http://localhost:11434), or on a separate machine that can be accessed by specifying the target URL or IP address.
options.ollama.serviceUrl.description.description: Description explaining the target URL for invoking Ollama services.

options.ollama.warningNoModel.message: Attention: No model found in Ollama, please proceed to install a model, e.g. Llama, as indicated on the official website.
options.ollama.warningNoModel.description: Message displayed when no usable LLM model is identified within Ollama.

options.openai.apiKey.description: API key field for OpenAI GPT.

options.openai.apiKey.description.message: Go to the API keys section to retrieve or create a key.
options.openai.apiKey.description.description: Description of the API Key section with details on how to retrieve it from the official OpenAI website.

options.openai.model.description: Model to be used for all text processing: https://platform.openai.com/docs/models/overview.

options.openai.organizationId.descriptio.message: For users belonging to multiple organizations, the (optional) value is used to specify which organization is actually utilized for a call, allowing for accurate counting.

options.openai.text2speech.audioQuality..description: Description of low-latency, but lower-quality model.
Description of higher-quality model, but without guaranteed low latency.
Description of model powered by GPT-4o mini.

options.openai.text2speech.speed.description: The speed of the generated audio.

options.openai.text2speech.voice.description: The voice to use when generating the audio: https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/text-to-speech/voice-options.

options.openai.text2speech.voice.descrip.message: The preview of the voices is the English one proposed by OpenAI and is not influenced by the configuration options present in this panel.
options.openai.text2speech.voice.descrip.description: Explanation that the preview voices are the official English voices provided by OpenAI and that they are not influenced by the options available in the add-on panel.

options.saveButton.description: Button used to save settings or preferences.

options.servicesTimeout.description: Timeout for services response in seconds.

options.testSuccessful.description: Text displayed when the integration test initiated through its respective CTA in the options window has been successfully completed.

options.translationLanguageCodes.description: Languages the user can select for translations.

options.translationLanguageCodes.descrip.message: The selected languages are those that will be used to create content translations. It is possible to select the language(s) that will actually be used for translations.
options.translationLanguageCodes.descrip.description: The displayed text shown to the user to explain the rationale behind selecting a set of languages.

thinking.description: Text displayed when waiting for a response from remote services.

options.xai.apiKey.description: API key field for xAI Grok.

options.xai.apiKey.description.message: Go to the xAI console site to retrieve or create a key.
options.xai.apiKey.description.description: Description of the website where it is possible to generate an API access key.

options.xai.model.description: Model to be used for all text processing: https://docs.x.ai/docs/models
